name: Grand Mercure Puka Park Resort

reviews.title: buah escape
reviews.text: We travelled to Puka Park on an extremely wet and windy evening. Roads in are very hilly and twisty. Receptionist very welcoming, as were restaurant staff. The room was warm for us when we arrived and the outlook from the room is just wonderful. The hotel is set in bushland and paths are fairly steep but it is such a pleasure to be there. Pauanui was very quiet but the beaches and views were wonderful. Petrol prices very high.
Restaurant staff were great, One staff member brought us feijoas from her home on discovering how keen we were on them. Magnificient views from restaurant.
reviews.title: Very Disappointing
Lovely rest at Puka
reviews.text: Found our room was not up to the standard we expected. It could have been much cleaner. The toilet was not cleaned and it was absolutely disgusting. It was cleaned after we contacted reception but really it should never have been overlooked. I had asked that there be a cot in our room when I made the reservation and then I called before we left home to remind the hotel and when we got there the cot was not there. It was bought in by staff who did not know how to assemble it and had to wait for some time for someone to come assemble it for us. Puka Park is definitely not worth the normal nightly rate. We will not be staying here again.

reviews.title: Disappointed
reviews.text: Stayed at Puka Park with my husband in 2010 and had a really lovely time, so we were excited to repeat the trip in 2011. But we're very disappointed. Firstly the reception was quite blunt and not very welcoming. We were often no bell service to the chalets which are quite a walk from the parking. We booked into the restaurant the night of June 4 and the service was quite lacking. It took a long time for our order to be taken and once taken we hardly saw the waitress. Both ordered medium steak with sides. The steaks came out after a long time but the sides were forgotten. My steak was medium well. We finally got our sides after catching a waiter to ask. We sent steak back to be warmed up because at this point were quite cold. Then my medium steak came out well done. Would have loved to have said something to the staff but again they were nowhere to be seen. The next morning went to make a cup of tea only to find out that the milk had expired on 24th of May. Almost 2 weeks old. Couldn't make tea the next morning because there had only been 2 tea bags, nothing was stocked up. Needless to say we didn't recreate our time in 2010 and probably won't be back to Puka Park.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are new to New Zealand. We have travelled quite a bit and found the hotel to be barely average. The rooms were spacious and great settings, but there were cob webs in all corners, and the vacuming was very suspect. The food was good when we could get service. We had lots of servers coming up to us and asking us what we wanted, however no one brought us anything until we flagged down a server. This happened at dinner, and at breakfast. In general, not good value for a premium price.
reviews.title: first time visitors
Fabulous weekend :-)
reviews.text: We had an amazing weekend thank you. The staff and service were excellent. We had waited over an hour to be seated for our dinner reservation, the staff more than made our wait comfortable and we were very pleased with how we were treated. The meal was delicious and more than made up for the wait. The only complaint we would have is a banging noise which was quite loud and went on for several hours during the night both nights which interupted our sleep. We thought it may have been a vent on the roof or outside wall. Otherwise we were very happy with our stay and would definately recommend this resort to our friends and look forward to returning.
We went to Puka Park for a relaxing weekend with some friends. Thats what we got. Although, we were on a budget, so we didn't experience the spa / massage etc. on offer.
reviews.title: Fantastic Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did, however, order room service one night for ourselves and our two children which was prompt and tasty and our childrens fussy eating was politely catered for over the phone. They even rang us back to check on a couple of details the chef wanted to confirm. Breakfast in the restaurant was delicious! And the service was quick, polite and consistent. We utilised the heated pool on both days... this was heaven for the kids, quite the novelty in Winter! We were at Puka Park at the same time last year and are intending it to continue being an annual event. So many things to do/see in the area.. Cathedral Cove was breathtaking and it was great to get back to a hot shower and yummy dinner.
reviews.title: Relaxing Weekend Away

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had read some of the reviews and to be honest we were a bit hesitant about staying at Puka Park, but decided to go and booked for 2 nights. It is an amazing setting with Tree Hut chalets dotted around the hillside of Mount Pauanui amid native bush. We arrived and were made to feel very welcome by the Receptionist. Our rooms were not quite ready ( having not arrived until check in time at 2pm thought this was poor) however the Front Desk was very apologetic and took us up to the restaurant and had a drink while we waited. Our Chalet was nice, windows however needed cleaning and cobwebs removed. The set up with the cupboards that housed the TV and DVD player was a bit odd..you had to close them every time you wanted to boil the jug etc. We booked for dinner on Saturday night and were not dissapointed. The food was excellent, but found the service varying. The side dishes however were fairly expensive.
reviews.title: Not what we expected
A Disappointing stay
reviews.text: Overall we enjoyed our stay, but just found the Resort a little tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 5 nights in early June this year in a 1 bedroom studio. Room was fairly dark & a bit tired looking. pathways were in need of clean & repair [broken steps & overgrown weeds]. floorboards on small porch were dirty & in need of painting. Carparks are at the bottom of the hill & it is a steep walk to any rooms, however you can get the staff to pick you up in a golf buggy.
reviews.title: Ok but could be so much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both the spa & sauna were not in service & the tennis court was not up to any resort standard. the gym is only fair & the pool & surrounds not very inviting.
reviews.title: Quiet & Charming

reviews.text: Breakfast food was OK but service staff, while friendly] just did not seem to be organised.
reviews.title: Maybe for a weekend...but not a week

aka: Grand Mercure Puka Park Hotel Pauanui
description: Grand Mercure Puka Park Resort is at Pauanui Beach, 2 hours drive south east of Auckland. This luxurious, secluded hideaway features 48 chalets set in 10 hectares of native bushland, an award winning restaurant, guest lounge and sun decks with views over the harbour and Pacific Ocean. Facilities include tennis courts, a swimming pool and the nearby beach has 3km of golden sand and surf to explore. A ferry service operates to nearby Tairua, home to many cafes and art galleries.
